header.div: Endings are as important as first impressions.

ol.li: Don't just tail off, or peter out, EVER.
Don't say how relieved you are the test is over!
Don't comment on your own performance.
If you really have nothing more to say about the question, look at the Examiner and say so. Do not just fade out!

Have phrases ready to use, to conclude what you say:
Have I given you enough information?"
"Shall I tell you more about it?"
"That's about all I know."
"Would you like me to explain anything?"
"Do you need to know anything else?"
Smile, say, "Thank you. Goodbye", and leave the room.

h6.p: Now you are ready for your speaking test.

ol.li: Use the unique experiences of your own life to enhance your performance.
Use your language skills simply and clearly.

div.p: Remember that what you are doing and what you are being tested on is communication.
